concept.title: Drawing
concept.shortdesc: Arrows are created in Beermat by adding arrowheads, otherwise known as markers, to the start and end of lines or paths. Only a Line or a Path can have a marker set to it

section.title: Locating the markers
section.p: The markers are located on the stroke widget along the top toolbar.

Expand each marker selection by clicking the blue arrow. Start markers are leftward facing, and are an exact reverse of the end markers.
End markers are rightward facing.

section.title: Using the markers on new Paths/Lines

ol.li: Have the Line or Path tool selected
Select a start and/or end marker
Draw your line or path, the markers appear as arrowheads. For further information on drawing see

section.title: Setting markers on existing lines and paths

ol.li: Select a Line or Path element on the canvas

Then do one of the following
Select a start or end marker. This marker will then appear on the line or path selected
Use the blank line, or arrow shortcut to automatically make the selected Line or Path a blank line or single headed arrow
